summary: The Return Review Program is one of IRS's key systems for detecting tax fraud and preventing bad refunds—preventing about $4.4 billion in bad refunds during the 2017 filing season. IRS monitors the program's performance and adjusts it to address new threats, but we found ways to improve and expand use of the program. For example, we recommended ways to increase the amount of data available...
title: Tax Fraud and Noncompliance: IRS Could Further Leverage the Return Review Program to Strengthen Tax Enforcement
